text: Very cloudy yellow. Taste is of grapefruit and bitter hops, a bit of orange as well. Not much going on really.

Can @ home. Clear yellow golden color, small to average white to off-white head that diminishes fairly quickly. Aroma is fairly faint. Taste lightly malts, lightly citrussy, citrus hops, hops, hop bitter. Decent body and carbonation. Nicely refreshing.
Wytrawne, trochę puste. Chmiel jednak nie do końca tropikalny; bardziej ziołowy. No i za dużo go jak dla mnie, Słody schowane kompletnie. Biwo bez wad, ale po prostu mi nie smakuje.
Pours golden with a fluffy head. Aroma is lemon and malt. Flavour is pale malts with a little bitterness. A nice blonde, easy drinker but not something Id rush out for.

Aroma; hops, pine, lemon, pale malts, mandarine, grass, freshness. Look; off white head, hazy pale hay golden body. Taste; hops, pale citric malts, pine, grapefruit, bittergrass, fresh fresh, mild but lingering tail. Feel; solid body, soft co2, nice. Overall; bright summer feeling in a can. [33cl.can 4.1%abv BB:Oct17 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Tromsø]

Produces up a misty, pastel yellow with fine conditioning and a stunted, compact crown of white foam atop. Fruity, tropical nose with hints of guava, passionfruit, pineapple and lime with a very subtle note of palest malt, pine needles and wheat. Quite light on the palate. It is piney and dry to get away from the esters of the aroma. Light grain, pine, sawdust with an assertive bitterness and lengthy bitter, flowery hop bite. Fruit esters are gammy and a little aside from that wonderful nose. It is highly sessionable but a little dowdy and heavy in the stomach despite its thin feel and light carbonation. Not bad, but just not altogether enticing. (33cL can, illegible date code, Cellarbrations Carlisle)
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Wytrawne, lekkie, delikatne. Ładny, chmielowy aromat. Świetna pijalność.
Can from Leighton. Lemony nose, honey and rich biscuity malt, so,me tropical fruits. Cloudy deep gold, low thick head. Sweet honey, biscuit, lemon, minerals. Rather low carbo, light.

Couleur blonde, mousse pas mal, nez qui fait penser à la Jack Hammer de Brewdog mais en plus léger. En bouche cest une sacrée débandade tant cest fade et aqueux. On sent quil y a du houblon, mais hormis lamertume ça manque de tout pour être réellement convaincant.
Cask at White Hart Tap, St Albans, UK. Colour is clear golden with tiny head. Aroma and taste are citrus, grapefruits, hops. Light bodied and low carbonation.

Shared can at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Moor Night presentation. Pale golden colour, moderate white head. Moderate aroma of Aussie hops. Herbal and grapefruity hops in the flavour, notes of pine and spruce too, medium dry. Moderate bitterness. Light bodied.
Shared can at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy light amber with white head. Aroma of sulfur, resin, tropical fruits. Tastes bitter, thin bodied. Bitter finish.
Pint of cask in pelt trader. Fresh. Great lacing. Citrusy and bitter. Tasty. Sessionable.

Keg @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 24-02-2017.
In short: enjoyable dry & bitter ale.
Pours little hazy pale gold with nice white head. Moderate head retention, good lacing. Herbal, zesty, citrusy, mango nose. Medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste is herbal, quite dry and bitter, smooth. dry finish. Very enjoyable.

33cl can from Beer52.com. A rather hazy pale amber pour with a billowing white head; aroma of tropical fruit; lots of tropical fruit flavours - pineapple, ripe mango, bitter grapefruit; then a long bitter fruity finish.

Aroma of fruits, citrus, pine, grass and some floral hops. Golden with a white head. Medium sweet and medium + bitter. Medium body with a average carbonation. Overall a very refreshing and quite enjoyable Golden Ale.
On tap @ BBB. Hazy golden with a small white head. Fruity and hoppy tones. Fruit, malt, hops and bitterness. Medium body with a bitter/ fruity finish.
Beautiful carbonation and subtle aroma. Very pleasant and easy to swig away at.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hazy yellow color with silky white head. Aroma has citrus, grass and pine. Taste is fruity with quite long bitter and dry aftertaste. Flavors of grapefruit, pine, grass and malt.
Fat @ Oliver Twist. Klar guldfärgad med ett frostigt vitt skum. Dofter av blomster, citrus och gräs. Smakinslag av citrus, krusbär, örter och gräs. Syrlig avslutning. Bra!

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Very nice hop character. Very drinkable and with a lot of citrus and resin in it.
Sample at Örebro Öl & Whisky 2016. Light smell, hoppy with citrus, pineapple and tropical fruits. Similar taste, light like the smell. Light body.
330 ml can, pours a hazy pale yellow. Smells of grapefruit and pine. Soft carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Big hoppy flavours with a dry after taste.
Frisk smag af lyse malte, og ikke alt for gennemtrængende humle, der passer godt til resten af øllen.

Can from September. Hazy golden with a medium sized frothy white head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Hoppy nose with citrus, mild cheese, peach and green plants. Mild flavour with citrus, peach, hay, dry flowers and golden bread. Very soft carbonation, mild sweet and medium bitter. Long dry hoppy finish with peach and flowers. Easy to smash.
Draught at Empourium. Pale hazy golden with full head. Lychee and spice aroma. Fresh bitter taste, some apple. Mefium body.

From tap, at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours pale gold with irregular white foam, extremely persistent. Aroma is grapefruit and lime. Body is light. Taste is moderately bitter, with some astringency.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
UPDATED: NOV 26, 2016 Foam tastes like Lemmon sherbet, smells great. Thin texture, mild pleasant hop taste, dusty, a little sour. Tends to vary from can to can.

330ml can. Hazy pale yellow colour with a small white head, nice retention and lacing. Aroma: floral hops, elderflower, tropical fruits. Taste: tropical fruit, floral, grass, lemon, citrus. Medium bitterness, oily texture, lingering bitter finish.

33cl can at home from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Nose is citric, light mint. Body is opalescent yellow, head is small, white, creamy, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruits, grass. Medium sweet, light bitter, light citric sour. Finish is long lasting hoppy medium to heavy bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Easy, refreshing, bit overhopped but thats why I like it.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2016 Handpump, Mastrobirrario, Trieste. Milky yellow, frothy golden lace. Orange peel, kumquat, green leaves. Light body, straw malt, citric finish. Light grassy finish. A bit too watery in the second half.

Sampled from a can from Prohibition Wines. Hazy straw colour, almost white, with a wispy white head. Zesty aromas and a taste with citrussy with plenty of grapefruit and pine resin. Lightish and refreshing. A very nice light, zesty beer.

Pajiza nebulosa, de espuma blanca y duradera. Aroma la lúpulo, cítrico, levadura. En boca gas punzante, muy refrecante, cítrica y especiada. Fruta tropical, mango. Seca y de amargor moderado, lupulada.

Can from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a cloudy straw colour with a thin whispy white head. The aroma is grassy hop, mineral, sweet honey. The flavour is moderate bitter with a light, big zesty hop bitter, acid citrus fruit, light peppermint spice palate. Medium to light bodied with lively carbonation and a bubbly mouthfeel.
Hazy golden, small white froth. Citrusy, mostly grapefruit aroma, light hints of malt and hay. Flavour is malty with citrus hops. Light but rather tasty. Dry with lasting citrus finish.
Canned, from backlog. Cloudy pale golden with off white head. Aroma and taste has citrus, flowers, pine, pale malt, fairly dry caramel notes with a hoppy finish. Light and slight oily mouthfeel
Keg @ Booth Wood Inn, Rishworth. Hazy pale amber with a small head. Has a mildly stewed tropical fruitiness, but crisp and very palatable. Possibly a touch thin.

Can from beermerchants. Appearance is cloudy and gold to orange. Head is thin and white. Light sweetness. Medium bitterness. Medium body. Finishes dry. Medium carbonation. Aroma is malt, hops, grass, spices, coriander, camomile. Awesome beer.

My Bottom Line:
This dry and bubbly hopheads brew shares citrus fruit galore and lemongrass allusions before green bitterness impersonates a few blades of grass.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sizeable head of foam covers the hazy blond.
-Im not sure this beer was intended to be that carbonated. In any case, it turned out to wonderfully complement the hop aroma and flavors.
-This brew has lots of personality.
-The citrus fruit allusions are impressive and not linear From lemons to starfruit, they are all juicy and fresh.

Bottle.
Cloudy golden body, white head. Aroma has some lemon, some light caramel, grapefruit. Really nice balance and good bitterness.
Hopfig trockener, rund hefiger Antrunk. Mittelstarke konstante Bitterkeit, recht herb. Muffige Heunoten, spritzig. 10/11/8/11//11
Straw blond with soapy head. Aroma and flavour are quite citrusy. Very dry and bitter.

Canned. Pours cloudy pale golden with a huge lacing off-white head. Aroma of citrus, flowery notes and a hint of pine. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and pleasant bitter. Light to medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice crisp and hoppy Ale. 🌟🌟🌟🌟
Drank at PP. Tangerine-tan cloudy pour, white fizzy head. Spicy lemon orange pith, lightly grassy hop. Body is bitter, stony, lightly spicy and frothy, astringent slightly puckering finish.
Pale gold, cloudy with a thin fluffy white head. Malty, lemon aroma. Taste is similar, citrusy, mild malt and a punch of bitterness at the end. Not bad.

duft: citrus limefrisk lidt vanilje sødme
smag citrus lime appelsin frisk juice lidt malt korn eftersmag
Can, 4.1% at KØ16. Mild grapefruity aroma. Cloudy yellow colour. Good stable creamy white head. Good citric and lemony flavour. Clean and good.

Can at DØE Ølfestival 2016. Low fluffy and quickly disappearing white head. Hazy light green body. Mild and smooth relatively sweet lemon grapefruit aroma and flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish. Well balanced and a nice surprise.

Can @ DØE. Hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, citrus and a little tropical fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, tropical fruit, little sweet, fruity and a little bitter.

330mL can from Booze Bud - BB AUG2016
Pale straw body, creamy white head.
Zesty hop nose - lemon & grapefruit, unripe rockmelon & honeydew, cut grass with an underlying grainy malt.
Body is light without being watery, good persistent flavour, moderate carbonation.
Touch of honey & cereal malt upfront more than the aroma suggests, hops are subdued but nice with notes of grapefruit rind, floral spice & leafy herbs, Lifted bitterness on dry crisp sort of finish.
Very pleasant beer.
Yellow colour, fluffy white head. Aroma of basil, citrus, may be some elderflower notes as they suggest. Taste is light to medium bitter, very crisp. Light body, slick texture, average carbonation.

Pours cloudy yellow with huge and persistent white head. Nose is flowery. Aromas are herbal hops and citrus (grapefruit, lemon). Low carbonation, light body. Long bitter finish. Quite good and refreshing. A great golden ale, almost reminding an American pale ale. Quite bitter indeed.

Cloudy yellow beer with a white stable head, the aroma is really good, several floral notes, sweet dough ones and some citric ones as well. The flavor is quite good the malt is not the strongest part of this beer, but the hops compensate everything, good to try.

330 ml can bought at Great Food Hall in Pacific Place, Admiralty.
Looks: Cloudy hazy light golden with lumps of yeast particles; Less than one quarter finger head with soapy white foam which fades in 20 seconds; Excellent sticky lacing and zero carbonation.

Aroma: Strongly fragrant and sweet Ale malt, with passion fruits, papaya, mango, floral nectar, honey, yeast, lemon zest and strong fresh grass.

Taste: Mid to light sweet fair Ale malt, with strong grapefruits, strong floral, molasses, resins, dry biscuits, yeast, strong lemon, strong biter hops, strong sharp grass.

Body: Close to light body. Slick and fairly oozy palate.

Mouth Feel: Fairly good Ale maltyness in a thin but very slick background. Very intense citrus flavors in solid grapefruits, strong lemons and sharp grass. Low sweet, quite Oozy and yeasty. Very refreshing!

Hoppiness: Passion fruits, papaya, mango, floral nectar, lemon and fresh grass in nose. Strong grapefruits, floral, resins, strong lemon and sharp grass in taste; Bitterness is strong for a lasting, very high astringent bitter sweet finish.

After Taste: Dry. Citrusy and strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: The brewer wants us to guess the hops here (sans Riwaka), and my two cents are mixes of Motueka and Nelson Sauvin. Anyway, I am surprised by its intense sweet tropical fruit aroma, and very strong citrusy hoppy taste all the way. It looks light but nothing wimpy in all aspects. A winner!

Jolie robe pâle avec son petit col de mousse fine ... amère citron / pamplemousse ... Classique ... Bien élevée & agréable à boire avec son faible ABV ... Finalement assez anodine ... Ni mieux ni moins bien que dautres en somme

medium body, soft carbonation, bitter.

I am not a big fan of low alcohol beers, nonetheless this beer is nice and bitter enough!medium bitterness,

Lata, @La Buena Cerveza, Madrid. 09/04/2016. 
Color amarillo, sabor frutal, final amargo.
Citrus and zest in aroma backed by old socks note. Fruity and citrusy in taste. Light bodied, fizzy carbonated, crisp. Finish is bitter. OK session beer ruined a bit by the of flavour aroma.

Puszka nabyta na Warszawskim Festiwalu Piwa 2016. Kolor jasnozłoty, mętnawy, piana niezbyt a raczej średnia. Aromat cytrusów i goździków, smak owocowy z cytrusami, orzeźwiające. Goryczka dość mocna, grapefruit. Dobre pijalne piwo.
Can, pours pale gold. Aroma is hoppy, lemon and grapefruit, light medium caramel malts, drying finish, light bitter with good balance. Light body, oily texture with soft carbonation.
Can, pours golden with a light haze and a fluffy head, pineapple, mango and fresh lemon on the nose, light fruity sweetness on the palate allies with a herbal dry bitterness and a crisp dry finish.

Cloudy light yellow color with a small but creamy head. Aroma has a distinct citrus peel, mango, pineapple, pine, resin, sponge cake and cat piss aroma. Mostly dry with medium strong bitterness. The bitterness has bay leaf and grapefruit peel notes and its lasting. Overall easy to drink and quite hoppy. Good one if you dont mind a typical UKs cat piss tang to it.

Can (Uppsala Beer & Whisky Festival 2016) - Golden in colour. Citrus, elderflower and some slightly biscuity notes in the aroma. Refreshing and clean taste with lemon, grapefruit, grape and elderflower.
Fra fat på Piccadilly Tap 15 Feb 16. Delt med Rune. Uklar aprikosfarget. Filmskum. Beskjeden fruktaroma. Smaken svakt fruktig med en lett syrlig ettersmak.
A hazy golden beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of malt, lemons, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of hops, fruits, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

Pours slightly cloudy golden yellow with a large and lingering white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, mango and pineapple. Taste is tropical fruit sweetness, mango sweet, minute caramel, a hint of grassiness, slight citric bitterness.

On tap. Colore giallo oro pallido. Schiuma bianca compatta, soapy, persistente. Buonissimo naso di luppolo fresco, pompelmo, frutta tropicale e fiori di sambuco. Carbonazione da media a vivace. Meraviglioso aroma di pompelmo, frutti tropicali, malto granaceo e floreale di luppolo fresco. Gusto molto soddisfacente, da mediamente a pienamente amaro, di ottimo luppolo in perfetto equilibrio col ricco carattere maltato. Finale di beva da corto a medio, pulito, amaro e finemente maltato. Di profumo seducente, rinfrescante e beverina, è una golden ale superlativa da casa Moor, superiore (non solo di corpo) alla sorella Norhop, di spericolata scorrevolezza ed entusiasmante resa. Poco da dire se non perfetta.
On tap at Churchkey. Big, fruity, juicy hops. Citrus and floral. Hard to define. Light bodied, mildly tart. Some funk, some mustiness. Id go with a session IPA, over a bitter.
Pours hazy golden with low white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, light passion fruit. Taste is sweet and fruity with a mellow bitter finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

Cask @ Holborn Whippet, London - UK. Color: cloudy blond beer with no carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: grassy and floral hoppy nose, sweet malt balance. Taste: medium body with sweet malt and some caramel notes. Balanced with grassy notes. Superb attenuation and easy drinkable. Aftertaste: wet bitterness, grassy and floral.
Bottle. Slightly cloudy with a golden appearance and a small head. Subtle bitterness with hops in background.Quite pleasant but not a lot of presence.
33 cl can. Fresh and juicy, grapefruit aroma. Gentle sweetness and bitter finish. Light and refreshing.

Can from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a cloudy golden colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of lemon, elderflower, some grapefruit, slight melon and floral hops. Taste of lemon sherbet, grapefruit, some melon, a little pine, subtle biscuit and slight floral hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A short, dry, citrus hop bitterness in the finish. A refreshingly, easy drinking beer with great tropical fruit, grapefruit and floral hop flavours. A great session IPA from Moor.
Light citric, hoppy aroma. Clean and really hoppy flavours. Not exactly layered and complex, but really satisfying.
Can from Real Ale Store, Newark. Hazy golden colour with a foamy white head. Citrus fruity aroma and taste. Light sweet to bitter finish.

Draft at Samo Pivo, Belgrade. Cloudy lemon yellow. Thick white pillow. Gorgeous citrus, very inviting. Sweet mild body but lots of rich, yeasty bright malts. Tropical fruitiness pervades. English character with new world hops. Delicious.

330ml can at home, from Good Spirits Company, West Nile Street, Glasgow (bb 30 Sep 2016), earthy, tropical fruits aroma, cloudy golden with a thin, white head, grapefruit and mango, bitter, modern hop finish.
Can. Bit dank again, light hoppiness, earthy. Taste has some fruitiness, but wheat is more prominent. Prefer it to the nor, but still not really sure.

BB AUG2016. Poured a clouded orangey amber colour with a one-finger white dense foamy head that retained OK before diminishing to a collar that laced OK. Carbonation moderate to high and fine. Aroma strongly of citrus (hints of grapefruit), pine and hops. Taste of sweet light malt, citrus (grapefruit) and pine with low to moderate hops bitterness. Light body with mouthfeel a bit thin. Crisp, dry with a lingering moderate bitterness.

Fruity floral aroma in a hazy light gold pour. Lovely tangy fruit taste with balanced both and crisp clean finish. An excellent beer - not just an excellent session beer (albeit slightly bettered by its northern sibling).

Cask at The Resting Hare, Euston, London. A hazy golden/yellow coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, citrus, tropical fruit on the nose. Tastes the same, hoppy, citrus, floral, hint of tropical fruit and quite bitter. Nice one.

330 ml can from Ales by Mail, bb Aug 2016.
Dark yellow, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, white head.
Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, pine, pineapple, orange, some biscuit.
Tastes of citrus, some grapefruit, pine, orange, pineapple, some earth, some biscuit.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, dry, piney, zesty, a bit earthy, a bit yeasty.

Very nice. Light and easy, but pretty fruity and piney, with a pleasantly dry finish. Great beer for the low ABV, pretty perfect session ale, no matter if you call this a Golden Ale or a Session IPA.

Tap (Wlodkowica21, Wroclaw). Piwo zmetnione o zlocistej barwie, bialej pianie, srednio pecherzykowej, ladnie krazkujacej. Aromat delikatny, cytrusowy, zywiczny. Srednia goryczka i pustka. Lekkie i pijalne, to fakt ale poza tym niewiele wiecej.

Can 33cl / Lata 33cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, España.
A: Hazy golden / Dorado turbio.
T/S: Malt, fruity, citrusy, slightly hoppy / Malta, afrutado, citrico, ligeramente a lupulo.
33cl can. Pours hazy golden colour with a medium to small off-white head. Aroma of fruity grassy hops, melons. Taste of grassy hops, tropical fruits, dry malt, leading to a bitter finish.
Si presenta giallo chiaro e limpido con schiuma bianca frizzantina. Al naso erbacea e floreale. Molto convincente il sapore luppolato ed erbaceo. Molto beverina e fresca.
Draft 0.33l at Samo Pivo Belgrade Serbia.28.09.2015.Pour it hazy yellow color with medium white. Aroma grassy.Taste so crispy, malty on the back, fruits also present, dry finish.
Can from Valhallas Goat in Glasgow. Pours cloudy gold with a thin white head, Quite dry and malty with nice fruit tones. A little bit watery in the mouthfeel but still a great refreshing beer.
Can from Cotteridge Wines. Really delicious hoppy golden beer. Nice tones - tropical and that. Fizzy too.

Bevuta aRoma alla spina. Colore giallo chiaro, schiuma chiara e cremosa. Profumi di erba e di campi. Al palato è un esplosoione di frutta tropicale miele e pesca. Meravigliosamente amara. Una meraviglia. Buonissima.

Keg at The Grapes, Oxford Thursday 15th October 2015 in the company of Geraint.   Hazy gold with a sticky white head, the hop aroma is a cheesy, a furry bitterness on the tongue, this is a nice beer. A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov16 3.6
Can thanks to Bob. Boy Moor is winning me over. Malty, exotic fruits, citrus, silk mouthfeel. All these cans are truly awesome.

At Eurhop 2015 in Rome - Italy, on tap. Pours hazy golden bright, never ending white foam. Nose: tropical, some funk far away, jungle. Mouth: fresh mango, crispy feel, a bit mineral. Dry. Bravo!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl can. BBE 08/2016.
Pours hazy golden color with a large white head. Nice floral hops and pine notes on the nose, mandarin, some grapefruits and subtle grassy notes also. Grapefruit and gooseberry flavor, some pale malts and hops. Bitter palate, surprisingly flavorful, the hop profile is also very nice.
3415

330ml can from beer merchants. Pours hazy blonde with foamy white head. Aroma is fresh lemon citrus. Taste is very light, grapefruit, floral notes and a mild citric bitterness. Refreshing but a bit too light and dry. Lacks the oomph of Radiance.
Dorado tupido y espuma blanca ligera. aromas cítricos, menta y floral. cuerpo ligero, sabor intenso y fresco, cítrico y herbáceo con final de amargor suave y seco.

250 ml. draft @ Gollem. The crew recommended me against drinking this one & said that they were complaining about the keg, they are not to blame in any way. I still wanted to try it. Hazy orange, small white lacing head. Nose is peach & stone fruit hops, light cheese & huge butter. Taste is pretty much pure butter, orange, marmalade, more sweet sugary butter, oil, candy, soap, light cheese; Pure butter. Surely this should not taste this heavily of butter? Drinkable but this really didnt seem right.

330 ml can. Pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of bright juicy fruitiness, a bit of orange pith and hops. Flavour is very smooth with heavy juicy bitterness, chewy grapefruity notes, a bit of herbs, mild sweetness and floral notes. Light bodied. Creamy mouthfeel. Super drinkable. I could drink a ton of this. A proper golden ale.

Draft @ Gollem. 
Pours clear blonde. Big white head fades fast. Smell is citrussy, hoppy and intense. Taste is mildly bitter, very much on the safe side here. Dry, yeasty flavor, notes of hops over a thin body with way to less malts. Just like the confidence, this is a wattery beer with an unintense taste. Kinda dont like it, to be honoust...
Bottle from Beergium. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - tangerine. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 270915

Can from beerhive. Hazy light lemon gold, white head. Lemony honey nose, floral hops. Lightish body, very soft fizz. Tropical juicy fruit but following the Moor Revival it is quite subtle. Long bitter finish. Good stuff.

330ml can from cornelius. Pours hazy pale yellow gold, thick white head. Aromas of lemon and light floral notes. Taste has light tropical fruit, more floral bitterness, tongue-coating in fact. Bitter linger. Nice.

Draught @ YNWA, Kolding. Pours slightly hazy light golden with a white head. Aorma of malt, light grain, fresh fruity hops, peach. Flavor is malt, grain, bread, light bitter fruity hops, peach, light citrus, flowers. Medium body, average to lively carbonation, light bitter finish. Nice and easy to drink. 110915

On cask @ the Hanging Bat.
Appearance - golden with a nice fluffy head. 
Nose - floral and citrus. Maybe some stone fruit too? Oranges and apricots Im going for.
Taste - yep, plenty of orange and apricot confirmed. Dry citrus tang on the finish.
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry but balanced finish.
Overall - very enjoyable.
Tasted from the tap on the 12/07/2015 at the Caminha Artbeerfest. Really nice and enjoyable beer. Quite hoppy but refreshing and easy to drink. Low alcohol and drinkable. Next one please!
Bottle shared at tasting. Pours pale yellow, small head disappearing quickly. Agreaable yet faint aroma of citrusy hops. Ligh body, even a bit watery, light bitterness.
Bottle shared. Pours hazy pale golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus and light fruits. Flavour is light sweet and over moderate bitter. Light to medium bodied with light carbonation.
Bottle @ Odense Summer Gathering, 2015. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Citrus, grass, bread and herbal notes. Medium bodied.
Odense ratebeer summer gathering 2015. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, light cheese. Taste is same, quite bitter and dry, citrus.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2015 660ml bottle from The Beerhive & 330ml can from Valhallas Goat. Hazy yellow, not much head. Grain & tropical fruit aroma. Sharp citrus fruit and hop flavour. Bitter citrus aftertaste. Big tasting hoppy golden ale. Good one.

Draught @ Youll Never Walk Alone, Kolding. Aroma is unusual with fruits, citrus, grapefruit, strong nettle tones and baking stuff. Flavour has grapefruit, citrusy tones, biscuits and hints of nettles. Quite refreshing - after 900 kilometers of driving.

[National Winter Ales Festival, Derby, 2015] - Moor Brewery So Hop!, 4.1% hellgolden trübt , sieht aus wie ein Hefeweizen. Aroma von Zitronen und florale, bittere Hopfigkeit. Hopfig Zitronig im Antrunk, sehr Butter, und das nimmt noch zu zur Mitte. Abgang hefig, zitronig, deutlich bitter. hopfige Bitterkeit hält extrem lange an.
I cant believe this is only 4.3%! Full of flavour, hops well and truly to the fore. Dont pass this one up. The worlds most flavoursome session beer?

Cask at the Euston tap. Translucent golden orange coloured pour with a lasting creamy white head. Aroma is light spicy citrus, lemon rind, fruity mango. Flavour is composed of pale grains, wheat, mango yougurt, slightly sharp citrus rind. Assertive citrus bitterness. Palate is lovely, soft medium carbonation, little grainy, really good condition. Super drinkable. Lingering grassy citrus hop. Really good.

On tap.
Hazy light Golden color, small White head.
Slightly sour Nose, hoppy taste with a light bitter finish.
Grainy notes.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Tap. Pours clear with a thin white foam. Aroma of passionfruit and citrus. Very tasty
Keg at ushers. A really classy brew packing in lots of hops for the relatively low abv. I could sink a few pints ofthis on a session.

Cask at Euston Tap. Bright yellow, hazy, cloudy, still, small creamy white head, light lacing. Aroma is light - just touches of caramel. Body is medium, slightly foamy, low carbonation. Taste has pineapple cubes, pithy citrus, grapefruit, straw, soft bitterness.

Keg at Drygate. Hazy golden beer with a thin white head. Flavour is an initial grapefruit, hoppy IPA affair but theres something else there I cant quite pick out. Maybe just the malt? Dont get the extra something in the flavour, which is more straightforward. Bitter, hoppy citrus. A touch of lemony sweetness to balance it. Theres not really a lot to say about it but its very nice.

On tap 26 april 15 @ Biercab, Barcelona.
Hazy darkgolden light amber color, with white head.
Aroma: tropical fruits, hops. 
Taste: little sweet, refreshing, nice fruits, hoppy bitterness. 
Like it!

Tap @YNWA, Kolding. Pours hazy pale yellow with a small, staying, creamy white head. Aroma has fantastic fresh hoppiness, freshly cut grass, lemongrass, dragonfruit, papaya, pineapple. Medium, prickly carbonation, fine dry and light creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has solid crisp malts, a touch of maize to it. Hops are softly bitter, fruity, again peach and pineapple. Delicious and fresh.
From tap. Pale golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus hops. Beer is dry, fruity with a decent amount of bitterness.

660ml Bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Penrith. Lovely dusty gold coloured beer, minimal sediment, which is always a bonus. Marmalade and apricot aroma, lovely and soft on the tongue, with just a little woody bitterness on the back of the throat, to balance it very well. Ive not bought their bottles before, Ill be getting more soon!

Draught at Taphouse.
Hazy golden colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and grass.
Fruity flavor of hops and grapefruits with notes of grass.
Dry hoppy finish.
From tap at Taphouse, Copenhagen. Cear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, hops, grass and malt.

Draft @ BrewDog Shepherds Bush, Shepherds Bush W12. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity grassy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grassy hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty grassy hoppy finish.

Aroma: intense floral hops, grass, some straw, spruce. Appearance: hazy, pale gold, small, creamy, white head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: bitters intensify, grass, floral hops again, dry finish. Overall: great Golden Ale, would almost have called this an APA, excellent bitterness. Pint at the brewery, Bristol.
31.1.2015. Nose has citrus hops, floral notes. Taste is quite mild but decent, malts, citrus hops, grass.
Wonderfull beer, with thiny body and average carbonation,a lot of fruits, some bitterness and a dry finish.

Love this golden ale. On tap at Biercab. Pours light orange/golden. Plenty of juicy tropical fruits, tangerine, melon, hoppy flavours going on. Really fresh and crisp. Mouthfeel a little thin, but I cand drink this every day. Delicious.
Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Tropical fruity aroma with a touch of malt. Sweetish malty and fruity flavour. Very tasty
sour citrus aroma, cloudy dull gold colour with no head, bitter lemon flavour quite dry in the finish but very good.
Keg in the Broadfield Inn, Sheffield. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Light fruity aroma. The taste is citrus along with some tropical notes. Nice bitter finish. I was hoping for more from this.

Drunk from 66cl bottle bought from deliciously different in Belgium. Golden very hoppy ale with citrus taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at the Bottle Shop tap takeover, London. It pours a hazy pale straw color with a medium white head. Aroma is juicy fruity tropical hops with grass lemon and hay. Taste is light to medium bitter and light sweet with more ripe fruit notes from the hops. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, great pale ale
Cask at the Holyrood 9a. Pours golden yellow, nose is floral, lemon, taste is similar.

Tap. Sheffield Tap. Poured into a Palm snifter glass. Looks boss, with a hazy gold body, and thick, lasting, glossy topped, bright white head. Nice pineapple hop. Some flora. Grainy, bready malt background. Bit of citrus. Fresh and vibrant. Taste is light sweet, turning, lengthy, gentle bitter. Decent body, with a massaging mouthfeel. Finishes crisp bitter, turning light dry in the close. Very nice sessioner.

Bottle from bottle-shop.eu. Golden colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Very easy drinkable. Bitter and dry. Notes of citrus and tropical fruit. Minimal sweetness. I could drink this all day. Wonderfull.

from Brewers Droop, Bristol
660ml Bottle [BBE:14NOV2015]
4.3% version

A favourite of the Bristol populous without a doubt. When I hear so much about a beer, I have a tendency to avoid it. I imagine it will lack interest and be a people pleaser, not an experimental or at least avant garde creation attempt. But after my experience with the same Brewerys Confidence I think it may be time to bite this bullet. Its a recent version - 4.3.% however, brewed at the new premises in Bristol.

First impressions for aroma are mandarin, citrus with some pineapple and even papaya like notes. Subtle hints of fairy liquid and tropical fruity flannels. The flavour is orange citrus with some lemon and a grainy caramel biscuit malt flavour. The overall impression is zingy, with tropical fruit flavours, sharp almost. This is balanced though, by the spotted malt backbone to bring the zing down to the ground and a peculiar dryness suggesting, as they mention, elderflower, or a white wine. Aside from being a bit more bitter than I expected, its a fairly safe beer, however it does bring some unique and exciting flavours to the table (or desk or floor) to warrant its place among what are considered more craft beers.

=72%
On tap at the Pelt Trader, Cannon Street. Gold pour with a white head. Aromas of pineapple, peach and pine. Bitter fruit flavours. Sharp, bitter mouthfeel. Interesting.

19/XI/14 - on tap @ Stormbird (London) - BB: n/a (2014-1350) 
Clear pale orange beer, nice creamy white head, very stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: citrussy, fruity, somewhat cheesy, smelly feet, hay, grains. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter start, cheesy hops, grains, bit metallic, malty touch. Aftertaste: citrus, grassy bitterness, bit cheesy, malts. Despite the cheesy stuff, still very nice refreshing and bitter beer.
On tap at Ale&Hop. Golden colour with white head. Hoppy, cheese aroma. Watery, bitter, floral taste. Light to medium body.

Draught at Our Black Heart, Camden on 30 Jul 2012. Poured a hazy golden colour, with a dense white head. Aroma of dusty grain, grassy hop and lychee. Fruity flavours of gooseberry, passionfruit and mango, mixed with biscuity malt. Finish was dry grain, resin and citrus.
Draft at Birch & Barley. Hazy yellow color, white head. Aroma of fruity citrus and straw. Taste is fruity, peppery straw. Not bad.

Cask at the Old Fountain, 28/11/14.
Hazed golden orange with a decent off white top that retains well.
Nose is juicy citric peel, tangerine, melon, straw, subtle hop presence.
Taste comprises soft bread dough, hint of peach, mandarin, straw, melon, lemon jus.
Medium body, soft carbonation, semi drying close laced with grassy hop bitterness.
Solid GB.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours a very pale light yellow with a bright white head. The smell is distant citrus, mild malt and elusive nose. The taste is citrus, lactic, tart fruitiness ending dry. Pretty pleasant but not remarkable.

Bottle from Cornelius. Hazy golden body with a thin white head. Very lively carbonation. Great lacing. Aroma of pot puri, apricot, lime and orange. Flavour of grapefruit, mango, honey and passionfruit. Thin to medium body with an oily texture. Light fizz. Refreshing and swiggable.

1/3 pint, keg at Mother Kellys Bottle & Tap Room, Bethnal Green. Close to clear pale golden body. Tiny white head, spotty lacing. Citrus smell, rather sweet. Lemony hops to the taste profile that also includes a touch of mango and mild malty sweetness.Semi dry, bittersweet ending. Like it. Paired nicely with the meat plate (London 26.09.2014).

Bottle from Cambridge Wine Merchants (Mill Rd), consumed at home. Yellow, bordering on straw. A bit hazy with a thin white head. Scent of lemon rind, barley sugar, a note of floral hop. Taste is a lemonadey sweet/sour, almost like a high-class radler but with a strong malt base. Finishes slightly more bitter. Floral hop aftertaste. A cut or two above your average golden beer, with complexity and innovation in the recipe.

Clean golden color, medium white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, malt, toffee, piny hops. Taste has citrus, malt, tropical fruits, grassy hops - sweet with medium bitter hoppy finish. Thin body and average carbonation. Nice golden ale.

bottle. Aroma of citrus, grass and grapefruit. Medium sweet flavor with citrus, grapefruit and pineapple, heavy bitter and dry finish. Smooth, refreshing and rather excellent. My nomination for best summer beer of 2014.

Pleasant enough - just needs more! ...Of everything - a bit more malt to give a bit more body and some more hops to amp it up flavour and complexity - dont get honey or elderflower as commercially described - watery but refreshing - Reasonable overall golden ale considering the lower abv - my preference is still Boneyard Golden Ale as best of the style in Australia.

Bottle shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Hazy yellow, white head. Nose is pineapple, mango, peach, hay, malty tones. Flavour is hoppy bitterness, mango-grapefruit, lime, fruit juice like characteristics. Very sessionable.

0,66L bottle (4.3% ABV version), BB 20.02.2015. Pours hazy golden with white head. The head stays. Aroma is fruity, peaches, and citrus. Taste is hoppy citrus, fruits, and caramel. Finish is nice long pine bitter. Overall: very nice session beer; tastes like hoppy fruit juice.

Color giallo dorato, limpida. Schiuma fine e pannosa ma poco durevole. Carbonatazione da cask ale, bassa che ne puoi bere a litri. Odora di pompelmo e frutti tropicali, di pepe nero e una punta di piccante. In bocca è liscia, esce un pò il gusto maltato ma viene subito sopraffatto dal luppolo che ha un finale deciso e molto persistente ma non troppo amaro.

A beautiful, powerful grapefruit & tropical smell. A bitter taste that builds to a crescendo of ultimate hoppiness! Those who like their tongues ripped out, salted & rubbed on a lemon will love this. Others, not so much...

Rated by BrewTom

Cask @ Ale & Hop, Barcelona

Pours hazy yellow with a smooth white head. Aroma of zesty fruitness, citrus, malts and grassy hoppiness. Taste is smooth, hoppy and fruity with zesty juicy notes, grapefruit and citrus. Finish is smooth, hoppy and lingering bitter with juicy grassy hoppiness. Nice, hoppy and tasty golden ale.

Bottle to tulip
Wheat, bread, lemon, hops, and molasses.
Clear, light yellow with tons of carbonation creating a fluffy and frothy long lasting 1.5 cm white head. Taste is straw, lightly roasted malt, lemongrass, and a nice light, but constant hoppiness.

Clear light yellow looking ale with smallish head. Aroma has lots of bitter grapefruits, flower notes and sweet tropical fruits. Taste is sweet with tropical fruits at first then turning into bitter grapefruit and citrus in the end. Light body and crispy carbonation makes this an easy to drink and easy to enjoy. Great bitter golden ale.
Ottima sessione beer. Molto pia come genere con amaro e fruttato che sovrastano i malti. Finale lungo
Cask at Euston Tap. Delicious, wonderful hops - aroma and flavour. Complex on palate, taste goes on and on. I?d drink this all evening but have a train to catch - I?ll look out for it again.

660ml bottle. Pours a clear golden amber, with a small white head, which lasts reasonably well and leaves a little lacing. Honey malt, floral and peach hops make up the aroma. Floral, lime and nectarine hops up front segue into a fairly light body, with subtle honey malt characteristics. Lime hops give it a refreshing finish. This is a quite restrained beer to serve as a hop showcase, but it works quite well and is nicely balanced. Definitely a good one on a humid summer evening.
On tap at Bere Buona Birra pub in Milan. Hazy gold with a nice foamy thick head. Aroma is citrus,grapefruit and hops. Taste is citrus,resin hops with a nice bitter dry finish. Lovely.
Cask at the Dean Swift in London. Lovely golden ale, the dry hop leaves a really pleasant bite that lingers around in the aftertaste. Notes of citrus and hay. Great.

Cask in The Dean Swift. Hazy amber, medium bubbly foam white head. Nose is pithy citrous, lemon and grapefruit, grassy, grain husky. Taste is lots of pithy citrousy bitter hops, grassy, very acidic. Too hoppy for me. Its too acidic. Cant really finish it.

Tap at hack & hop, London. Pours a cloudy yellow straw colour with a thin white head. Aroma is fresh, grassy with lemon and mango. Medium body, medium carbonation. Nice - a lot of sweet tangerine, a touch of veg funk, candy. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

.66 bottle. Yellow, hazy. Excellent hoppy nose with white currants, some cat pee, lychees. Overall a nice green fruity berry aroma. Light body, bitter. Fruity hoppy flavour. Pale, slight dry malts. Llong and refreshing finish. Probably one of the best hoppy 4%s Ive had. Tasty, without being over yeasty or as sterile and lifeless as some of the superhoppy sub 5% ones. Great refreshing palate cleanser.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy yellow pour with big fluffy white head, 
tropical fruit aroma, taste had grapefruit pineapple some hay crisp tasting hoppy golden, whats not to love?
Hazy amber. White head. Aroma - hops, citrus. Taste - sour, fresh, hoppy. Would like it to be a little bit more hoppier and a little bit less sour.
660ml bottle. Hazy yellow straw color. Medium size white head, stays. Hops, fruity, sweet notes in aroma. Grapefruit, earthy, citrus, mild sourness in flavor. It smells better than tastes.
chiara leggermente velata schiuma media discreta persistenza naso piuttosto luppolato erbaceo con una nota fruttata tropicale lieve nota maltata buona secchezza buon amaro bella beva

600ml bottle (Gambrinus, Tartu)
Simple hazy orange, tight head. Aroma of sickly sweet tropical. NZ hops everywhere, Nelson Sauvan presumably. Quite simple in the mouth, but drinkability is very high - delicious. Soft malts, touch sweet abd bready. Lovely fruit flavour, gently earthy bitterness, drying bite in teh finish. Every swallow makes you want to take another. Acidity of hops very high, alas harsh in places, but the sessionability of this is stunning. Just want another glug. Such a shame about the hop acidity which does build up.

Bottle, Chester Beer & Wine. Hazy yellow pour with a white head. Plenty of fruit in the snout. married with some grassy hop, a theme which continued on into the flavour which had hop bitterness that was relatively understated but pleasing. Really drinkable - another good Moor beer.

Bottle - Lots of tropical fruits, pineapple, mango and orange. Pale clear gold with a thick white head. Nice and fruity with a bit of a bitter resinous finish. A great ale with a nice low ABV, hard to come by these days.

Bottle, 66 cl, at Christianssand Brygghus. A finger-thick off-white head leaves lacings when the unclear, pale golden beer disappears. Some grass in the aroma, with hints of pine cones. Malty notes. Dry on the palate, soft carbonation, with a good bitterness in the flavor. Smooth and lasting finish. Not a very interesting one, but tasteful and well brewed. 130729
Bottle, shared with Smitty. Hazy bright yellow, lively white head. Lots of white grapefruit, a little cat piss, gooseberry. Light straw-like malts. Quenching, excellent.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Nice hop aroma, with a clean malt palate. Very drinkable beer with plenty of hop aroma and flavour.

0.66l bottle. This is a light blurry bright golden one with a nice medium sized just off-white top thats lacing nicely down the sides of the glass. It has a fresh, definitely hoppy and fruity nose. Soft pine, spruces, lots of peaches and some pineapple as well. Impressive aroma. It has a really lightdrinkable and somewhat thin mouthfeel with a soft carbonation level. Its somewhat dry, I get lots of citrus and grapefruits in the taste. Bitter grapefruit, some minerals, more grassy than the aroma and traces of fruits in the finish. As mentioned its really light and easy to drink. High quenching potential, but that "golden" thing is disturbing a bit, even if its just my personal preferences. All in all not a bad one this. 28.03.2013

Pours pale amber with a small head.
Nose shows grassy, earthy hops, some resinous notes, honey and plain sweet malt.
Pretty hoppy flavours, big pine and grapefruit along with some biscuity malt.
Could use more carbonation.
Pretty easy-drinking stuff.
Bottle. A golden ale if an American or a hop-addict home brewer made it. A nice golden ale with a bathtub of grapefruit. Very tasty
Det här var en lite oväntad och intessant öl som var otroligt läskande. Smaken var fylld till bredden med frisk syra, citrus och passionsfrukt. Slutsats: hyfsad öl men sjukt kul att dricka.

White frothy head gold pour medium carbonation aromas passionfruit citrus pineapple the flavours resiny pineapple strong bitter grapefruit some rind for the bitter taste passionfruit mild honey malt the finish good on palate nice aftertastes of mixed fruits lasting bitter nice ale

Bottle at Christianssands Brygghus.Pours clear straw coloured with i thin white foam. Aroma of citrus hops, tropical fruits. Taste is crisp, high carbonated, spritzy mouthfeel, lots of citrussy and fruity hops. dry and clean mouthfeel, light and tasty pale ale.

660ml bottle from The Wine Emporium. There is a lot of foam when this beer is pour. God golden amber colour with fruity aroma. The beer is light in the mouth and on the palate with a smooth fruity flavour.

660ml bottle pours a slightly hazy straw color with a finger of white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass.  Aroma is citrus and pine with some light grains and hints of pineapple.  Taste is a citrus and pine hop bitterness with some light malty and fruity sweetness with a hint of tart from the pineapple.  Very nicely balanced brew with a light body and moderate carbonation.  A fully flavored beer which satisfies the palate while being easy to drink.  Very well done.

Bottle, 12C. 4.3% ABV. Just hazy pale gold with a white head. Citrus, tropical and cut grass aroma. Light-bodied, lowish carbonation. A little sweet hay cant wait to get out of the way of the Kiwi hop flavours - theyre very bright with oranges, grapefruit, gooseberry, mango, light passionfruit and lawn clippings. Finish is dry and quite bitter. Straight-ahead refreshment; lovely use of Kiwi hops.

Yum.  Punchy and fresh nose with loads of mango, papaya and pepper.   Pours a hazy pale gold.  Flavour is fat and fiery with notes of grapefruit, roasted meat, more pepper and tons of pine needles.  And pine sap.  Finish is dry, coarse and long with a hoppy crunchiness that belies the beers strength.  Hugely refreshing and hugely moorish(sp).  Ace.

660ml bottle off the folks for Xmas, split with the missus. She got at least an eggcups worth. Pours pale yellow, finely hazed, under a loose but persistent white foam. Aroma lemon, lime and pineapple jellies; pine, grass, dunked biscuit and darjeeling; slight foxiness. Taste: vanilla-infused cream shaved with grapefruit, lemon and peanut. Good dry hop linger with softening malt. Really good biscuity malt. Fine beer so easy to throw back, if a little watery after a brace of Kernels.

Its powerful grapefruit citrus characters are literally breathtaking, they use Riwaka hops which are unfrequent, but wow!
It is hazy gold with medium white head.
Mouthfeel a little thin, but this is pretty much a complete session beer for NZ hop searchers.
Very easy to drink so be careful!

Cask handpull at Holborn Whippet.  Pale gold slight haze lasting white head 
good tropical fruot aroma. good mouthfeel not too bitter on the finish. decent golden ale.

([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bridge Tavern) Pours a hazy gold with medium white head, healthy lacing, medium in body and carbonation. Aroma/taste is tropical/citrus hops, pale malt, mineral, pine. Lovely palate/mouthfeel. Very good.

0.66l bottle. Pours a golden cloudy colour with a medium thick white head. Citrus and grassy aroma with a taste of hay, yeast and a long bitter aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg, Sweden. Clear golden, medium white head. Strong citric hop aroma, very clean such. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness. A good thirst quencher.

From tap at Stockbridge Tap. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is smooth fruity, peachy to grapefruity and peachy. Smooth grapefruity and bitter. Smooth fruity and crisp lingering hoppy finish.Earlier Rating: 11/19/2010 Total Score: 3.3From cask at Marble Arch. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is mild hoppy and citrusy. Crisp hoppy. Citrusy and mango hopsfruity into a dry and bitter to bone dry finish.

(Draught at MacKinlays Inn, Stockholm) Pale golden colour with brief, white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with lemon, grapefruit, grass, green grapes and hints of resin. Fruity, hoppy taste with notes of lemon, grapefruit, gooseberries, green grapes, grainy malt and a solid resinous/citric bitterness in a dry finish. Medium body, quite dry. Impressive hop presence, but still quite refreshing and easy to drink. Nice one.

Bottle.  Hazy gold with a white head.  Aromas are gooseberry and white grape with lemon and bags of yeast.  Floral with light pineapple and grapefruit.  Very low biscuit malts with hints of wood and peanuts.  Flavours are sweet mixed tropical fruit with yeast and lemon barley water.  Resinous and herbal with grassy notes and a very spritzy palate.  Dry on the finish.  Refreshing.

Draught @ The Rover. Pours tiny hazy pale golden with a frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick lacing on the glass. Smell is floral, tiny herbal and hoppy with white read, crackers, grapefruit juice, orange zest, pineapple, black currant leaves, gooseberries, grass, pine and hints of resin. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter as fruity with crackers, grapefruit juice, pine, freshly cut grass, dark grapes, gooseberries, lemon zest and unripe currants. Mouthfeel is crisp, dry, tiny astringent and light bodied. Finish is dry and bitter with grapefruit rinds, pine, grass, lemon zest, unripe berries and crackers. Hoppy and nicely refreshing.

66cl bottle. Pours light orange/golden with thin bright white head, decent lacing. Plenty of juicy tropical fruits, tangerine, melon, kiwi fruit, gooseberry - very fresh; touch of yeast complexity. Taste showcases those sweet and juicy tropical hop notes really well - not much malt character to speak of, but thatâs fine given the fabulous hop flavours going on. Again, the word âfreshâ comes to mind - lovely and crisp at the finish with a light touch of residual bitterness. Mouthfeel a little thin, but this is pretty much a complete session beer for NZ hop fans like myself. Delicious.
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. A cloudy yellow beer with tangerine and vanilla flavours, lemon zesty notes and a bitter, slight sour finish.
On-tap. Ölrepubliken, Göteborg. Pale, hazy yellow colour with a white head. Hoppy, fruity, citrusy, very dry, not much malt in there. Light body and smooth carbonation. Nice!

Draught Ölrepubliken 2012-10-05 Göteborg
AR: tropical fruits, 
AP: hazy dirty honey yellow, frothy yellow white head
F: tropical fruity, fizzy, grainy, grape fruit bitterness

Draught at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg. Pale golden beer with a quite lasting white head. Fruity hop aroma, pineapples, grass, mango, pear, pine, grapes, citrus, fruit cocktail. Hoppy pine flavor, metal, grass, grapefruit notes, hay, floral notes, citrus, pineapple, dry bitterness and with spice notes. Hugely refreshing, and with a nice body. Very nice peppery finish with grapefruit, citrus and pine.

Bottle 660ml @ Christianssand Brygghus, Kristiansand
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus and pine. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with a rather short citrus fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

660 ml bottle @ Christianssand Brygghus. Practically clear, pale golden body with a nice white head. Weak but nice aroma of grain and fruit. Flavor is much the same as expected from aroma, light malt, grain with a light fruitiness and moderate bitterness. Medium body and a bit short in aftertaste. Decent and quaffable, but not outstanding.

Draught @ The Holborn Whippet. Pours a light golden color with a small white head. The nose is bright citrus and summery fruits - plenty of melon, some apricot and hints of lemon. The taste is light dried grass, lemon rind. Some fresh sugar cookie and more summer fruits. Light body, mildly bitter. Overall, fairly decent.
Bottle at Christianssand Brygghus. Pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, malt, hop, fruit. Flavour is citrus, malt, hop, fruit. Medium body. Ordinary beer.
Bottle @CB. Pours cloudy golden with an off-white head. Aroma malt and fruitiness with some floral notes. Flavor is sweet and fruity with wheat. Medium body, average carbonation .

20th August 2012On tap at the Black Heart, Camden. Hazy gold beer, tidy white head. Smooth palate, softish but with mild fine carbonation. Dry. Minerals. Mild grapefruit - tangerine hops with subtle tropical fruits underneath. Trace of melon. Semi crisp finish. Easy going pale ale, tasty and light.

Sampled from 66cl bottle at Beer Enthusiast release party, Håndverkerstuene. Pours clear, pale golden with a nice, white head. Hoppy and fruity aroma with malt, yeast and hints of peach. Medium sweet and lightly fruity with a quite dry, lightly hoppy and pleasantly bitter finish. Refreshing and easy to drink.

On bottle at Håndverkerstuene.
Golden color, good foam.
aromas of hops, good intensity to the level of abv.Some fruity notes, and some influence from the yeast.
Light body & medium complexity.
Good bitterness
Very enjoyable

Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is fruity, floral, caramelly and mild earthy notes with some slight nectary notes as well. Flavour is fruity, wooden, floral, grassy and quite herbal as well. Rather bitter finish.

Cask (handpump) @ Port Street Beer House, 39-41 Port Street, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England M1 2EQ.Clear medium yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate hoppy, citrus, grass, cat piss. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20120122]Earlier Rating: 7/19/2011 Total Score: 3.8Cask (handpump) @ Southampton Arms, 139 Highgate Road, London, Greater London England NW5 1LE.Clear medium yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, toasted, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, lime. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, citrus lemon peel, hops, citrus lemon. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20101203]

Cask at The Old Red Cow, London. Pours clear yellow with a weak, white foam head. Has a bit of straw on the nose, with notes of melon and citrus fruits. Medium sweet flavor with big and juicy citrus, quite a bit of melon, grapefruit and pineapple, light bitter grass. Light to medium in body with fine carbonation. Sweet finish with lots of juicy citrus and tropical fruits, touches of wheat and dough. Very refreshing.

Cask at the Southampton Arms. It pours cloudy golden yellow, with a medium white head. The nose is pine, peach, farmyard, sweaty sock, resin and straw. The taste is straw, pine, resin, soap, lemon pith, astringent bitterness and grass, with a dry, citric finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Good bitterness, but too soapy for my liking.
Keg at Holyrood 9a. Golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus an grass. Flavour is dry and lemony. Nice bitterness to finish. A crisp golden ale. Very enjoyable.
Key at Holyrood 9A, EIBF 2012. Pale gold, thin frothy white head. Definite melon, light lemon, some grasssy hops. Dry hops, light bready malt, juicy lemon, peppery bitter finish. Prickly CO2. Good.

Keg at holyrood9a.
Pale blonde with spicy pineapple nose. Medium carbonation, snappy bitterness, watermelon, shortbread malt.

Key Keg at The Black Heart, Camden, London. Cloudy gold with white head. Quite a bitter beer, sharp with a refreshing dry hopped flavour, greengage, goosegogs and tangerine pith. Lasting on the palate, lengthy finish. Very decent.Earlier Rating: 9/13/2010 Total Score: 3.7Cask conditioned at Minehead Beer Fest 10. Gold with white head. Tasted in conjunction with the Northern Star. Same biscuity, clean malty body, this having hints of gooseberry and tangy lime, fruity, bitter. Just as clean and refreshing, but the Northern Star just won on flavour.

On cask at The Stockbridge Tap. Pours a blonde colour with a thin white head. Aroma of lemon, caramel, grassy hops and a little yeast. Similar flavours and quite dry with mild carbonation and CO2 prickle and an oily mouth-feel. OK.
cask at the tap ... glden yellow .. thin white head .... soft floral zezty lemon nose ... juicy fruits ... soft floral lemon ... light bitter linger

18/01/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (cask). Dorata viva con riflessi ambrati, schiuma assente. Aroma delicato ed elegantissimo di pompelmo, arancia e pesca, con note caramellate e mielose. In bocca è morbidissima, mirabilmente bilanciata nel rapporto dolce-amaro, con un corpo notevole per essere una session beer, ma di una beverinità estrema. La regina delle golden ale, senza ombra di dubbio. Una delle birre più eleganti e sopraffine che io abbia mai bevuto.
Cask. Frothy white good mostly demnishing head. Yellow colour. MOderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.
Cask @ Craft Beer Co. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits, citrus and malt. Nice and bitter.

Cask at Crown & Sceptre. Slightly hazy gold with a small wispy off-white head. Aroma - thats .... Stunning;  catty, grassy, light grain, a bit of alcohol - a near-perfect hoppy cask aroma (9-).  Taste follows, perfectly balanced yet still hugely hoppy, but also restrained - light body and astringency, mild carbonation, lightly acidic, and it finishes quickly enough you keep pulling at your pint until SAME AGAIN, PLEASE!!   My cask highlight of the entire trip.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2013 Cask (handpump) at the Southampton Arms on 3 December 2010 as Southern Star. Clear pale god colour. Lively condition. Big grassy and oily hop aroma - some gooseberry leaf. Dry and citric on the palate. Just a little less in the flavour than on the nose. Beautifully drinkable and packed with character for a relatively low ABV beer.

Aroma: fruits, caramel, herbs
Appearance: pale, yellow
Taste: honey, peach, apple, hops
Palate: low
Overall: 17/20

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2011 Cask @Brasserie 4:20 (Rome) - Wow! By far the best Golden Ale Ive ever drunk! Its really impressive... unbeliavable! Deep aroma of hops and fruits (apples) with honey and caramel notes. Taste is amazing, hops and quite bitter but perfectly balanced with caramel, malt and honey. Low-medium body. Fresh, drinkable, elegant. A great beer! So impressed!!

LIVE RATING. Cask at Southampton Arms, London on 29 November 2010. Sandy gold with part-lacing white thin foamhead. Hoppy cheesy nose; beautifully hoppy in-mouth: grassy and bitter hempy hoppiness in generous supply. A fruity back-taste comprises berries and citrus, and a developing bitter finish builds depth and length with continued drinking. But for its 4.1 ABV rating it would make an ideal session ale. I loved it.

(Cask at CASK Pub & Kitchen, London) This was nice, fruity and hoppy beer. No flavour or aroma was so intense that it would have hidden others. Even maltiness was clearly present and brought nice solid base for all the other flavours. I was pleased.

Cask. Straw colored beer with an off-white head. Hay and fruity hop aroma with light floral notes. Hay and fruity hop flavor. Medium body. ay, malt, light spice, and fruity hops linger. Very drinkable, but didnt stand up to the Queens Revival I had side by side.

Mr Moor has done it again.  My first wow beer made with Kiwi hops was Roosters/Outlaw Wild Mule a couple of years back (I think) when all this green gooseberrylicious Marlborough Sauvignon flavour burst up my nose.  That was/is an excellent beer but Southern Star is better.  These hops are so focused and aromatic it would be shame not to use them for aromatic purposes.  A wonderful nose of gooseberry and citrus with a hint of honey/vanilla/malty character that is so appetizing. Green and grassy, as soon it enters your mouth a quick rush of hops engulfes (gently yet quickly) your entire mouth before rounded, soft, slightly sweet and assertive malt takes charge to form the base for the hops to shine.  And boy do they shine, just like the sexy, classy, green tinged, pale, golden colour of the beer itself, as if New Zealands sunniest day arrived alongside the racy Riwaka and jumped into the glass headfirst enjoying every second.  All the green flavours bounce around the palate before an immaculately measured bitterness kicks in and allows everything to linger for much longer.  Great sight, great smell, great taste, great finish - complexity and drinkability, aromatics and body, its all there.  Next week I get to try some thats unfined and I really cant wait!

Cask-conditioned at the Bag ONails, Bristol 16/09/09. Golden in colour with a decent, frothy white head. Hoppy aroma of gooseberries, citrus and also some balancing sweetness. Very easy drinking, with plenty more fruity New Zealand Hop character, a touch of caramel and a lingering, dryish finish. Hugely drinkable.
